walkthroughs.title: Get Started with Substreams
walkthroughs.description: Build, stream and publish your first Substreams

steps.title: Start building
steps.description:
There are plenty of already existing modules on [substreams.dev](https://substreams.dev), you can start from one of them:

[Download module from Registry](command:substreams.loadFromRegistry)

If you prefer, start from a code generator, or start from scratch:

[Scaffold new module](command:substreams.runInit)

or run: ``substreams init``

steps.title: Get an API token
steps.description:
Get streaming immediately with a lower-powered API token, ideal for initial exploration (these keys are short-lived):

[Get a lower-powered API key](command:substreams.getSimpleApiKey)

Create an account on [thegraph.market](https://thegraph.market), to benefit from The Graph indexers, and a free 1 TB/month:

[Create account on The Graph Market](command:substreams.marketAuth)

or run: ``substreams auth``

steps.title: Start streaming
steps.description:
This is where it gets exciting: see the data flow. Choose between:
[Run: `substreams gui`](command:substreams.runGui)
or, find __Substreams: Run Substreams GUI__ in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.showCommands) (Cmd+Shift+P / F1).

steps.title: Index the data
steps.description:
Create a subgraph based on your Substreams module:

[Generate subgraph](command:substreams.initSubgraph)

or run: ``substreams codegen subgraph``

Prefer direct SQL? Send your Substreams' module's data into postgres:

[Generate SQL Sink](command:substreams.initSql)

or run: ``substreams codegen sql``

steps.title: Query the data
steps.description:
This environment contains a Web interface to your postgres database:

[Open web view to Postgres](command:substreams.openPgWeb)

You're developing a subgraph? Query it directly within VS Code:

[Open GraphQL into a subgraph](command:substreams.openSubgraphQuery)
